actions.text: Committee on Rules ordered to be reported an original measure.
Committee on Rules. Original measure reported to Senate by Senator Ford. Without written report.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 128.
Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment by Voice Vote.

official_title: An original resolution to authorize the Secretary of the Senate to discharge certain functions under chapter 37 of title 31, United States Code (relating to claims of or against the United States Government).

summary.text: Requires the Senate to be considered a legislative agency and deems the Secretary of the Senate to be the head of such legislative agency for purposes of provisions relating to claims of or against the Government. Provides that regulations prescribed by the Secretary relating to administrative offset shall not become effective until they are approved by the Senate Committee on Rules and Administration.

titles.title: An original resolution to authorize the Secretary of the Senate to discharge certain functions under chapter 37 of title 31, United States Code (relating to claims of or against the United States Government).
